oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A comparison study of common concerns and diseases of the small ruminant producer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roberson, J.
Mittleider, T.
Cameron-Blake, N.
Gibbons, P.
Cappiello, B.
Wilson, T.
Larson, R.
Dubois, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: management practice
geographic location
economy
small ruminant producers
St. Kitts
Appalachia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Limited research has been published on the common concerns of small ruminant producers and their management practices. The problems affecting producers may differ depending on geographic location, economy and culture. The purpose of this study was to identify and compare the most important concerns and diseases among the small ruminant producers of St. Kitts and the Appalachia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 399
